Module frogger
Package frogger.model.actor.movableActor

Class Turtle

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.image.ImageView
        • frogger.model.actor.Actor
          • frogger.model.actor.movableActor.MovableActor
            • frogger.model.actor.movableActor.Turtle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    public class Turtle
extends MovableActor

    Turtle

    The Turtle class is used to create the Turtle object.

    A Turtle object is set in Map. It can move with the constant speed and change the image as time goes on. In each frame, this object also check the wall touch and check whether there are animal intersect with it. When it touches the Frog, it will ask GameController to handle some consequences.

    Note: This class extends MovableActor abstract class and implements MovableActor.act(long) and MovableActor.checkTouch().

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wenzheng Shan
    See Also:
    Map, MovableActor, GameController, Frog

    • Field Detail

      • turtleImages

        private java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.image.Image> turtleImages
        An ArrayList which contains all the images that Turtle will change with time goes on

    • Constructor Detail

      • Turtle

        public Turtle​(int size,
              double xpos,
              double ypos,
              double s)

        The constructor of Turtle class to generate instance

        This constructor sets the Turtle in the given position x and y in the Map. Set the constant speed in the given speed. Set the initial image with the given size. And initialize the ArrayList image which contains all the different shapes of Turtle

        Parameters:
        size - The size of the image
        xpos - The position of x in the Map where digit stays
        ypos - The position of y in the Map where digit stays
        s - The speed of Turtle movement

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act​(long now)

        This method will do the following tasks: 1. change the image of Turtle as time goes on. 2. move the Turtle 3. check whether Turtle has touched the right or left wall 4. check whether Turtle has touched the Frog

        This method that will be called by ActAnimation in every frame to execute all above tasks.

        Specified by:
        act in class MovableActor
        Parameters:
        now - The current time of calling method.

      • checkTouch

        public void checkTouch()

        This method checks whether Turtle has touched the Frog and call GameController to handle consequences.

        When the Turtle is intersected with Frog, it will call GameController.handleLogTurtleTouched(MovableActor)

        Specified by:
        checkTouch in class MovableActor
